intro: Solanum tuberosum var. hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish potato, is a variant of the common potato with distinct botanical characteristics. It is an herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is native to the Iberian Peninsula. The plant produces starchy, tuberous roots that are typically smaller and more elongated than those of the standard potato variety. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. The flowers are typically yellow with a distinctive purple calyx, and the plant is known for its adaptability to various soil conditions.
